title: Does anyone honestly like the new "Ally Slain/Enemy Slain" headers?
body:
"We've read through your feedback and are making a number of tweaks and improvements aimed at making announcements cleaner and less intrusive. For clarity"

...

"Summoner names have been removed from some announcements for brevity."

Where was the consensus taken that this needed to be changed? Why couldn't I have participated? This is sort of a big deal imo. 

Idk maybe it's just me, but I much prefer to see/read "{{champion:92}}xx420blazexx has slain fioramaster69{{champion:114}} ." What we got with this update ({{champion:44}}  Enemy slain {{champion:81}}) just feels really bland to me. I don't like it at all.

I think this should be reverted- or at least should not stay the way it is. Anyone else with me?

**@Riot **Many people wish for a toggle option- would this be at all possible?

It looks unprofessional- the layout- on the side of Riot, not on the side of us players, I guess.

I also REALLY miss the summoner names popping up when people die. Some of them were hilarious, and all of them made the game feel more like I was playing with real people as opposed to alone.

Why did they remove this? It seems like such a dumb idea. Someone's probably just trying to be politically correct or keep the little dead kid from feeling upset or something...but that has no place in a combat- and objective-focused game like LoL.

Politically correct is an oxymoron. 

It's been decades, and people still entrust themselves to an oxymoron. It's like "military intelligence".

I feel it dehumanizes/desensitizes people in league. I mean, there are always those people that rage that remind you there are people there, but a lot of the more silent ones, it just makes the game feel foreign, as though those aren't named people and more like bots. You could almost just as well change their names to Summoner 1,2,3,4,5 respectively instead and only show usernames out of game. I don't like the feel it gives to the game.

I'd give it a solid "meh"/10.
